description:
Mô Tả Công Việc
             

              The main goal of the LG Robotics Program is to improve student learning in STEAM education and to inspire students to consider careers in the math and sciences.  We also want to build a strong program so that our students can eventually participate in LEGO Robotics competition.
              

              We are seeking an enthusiastic, skilled and creative Computer Science/Robotics Teacher to join the LG team. Our Computer Science/Robotics teacher will be an important part of our enrichment teaching team, supporting the school in its ability to offer high-quality education to our student body. The program will focus primarily on an introduction to computer programming using curriculum developed by MIT Scratch programming language and a basic introduction to robotics using Lego Mindstorms and WeDo.
              

              Coach will:
              
              Collaborate with a certified teacher and co-teach Robotics and Coding classes
              
              Model how to program and build structurally sound robots using the LEGO Mindstorms and WeDo Robotics Kit, and support groups of students in building and programming their own.
              
              Teach elementary school students the principles of Robotics including the functions of power source, sensors, motors and structural members of a robot.
              
              Document the students' individual and group progress throughout the program.
              
              Support students during independent homework time

requirement:
Yêu Cầu Công Việc
             

              Qualifications:
              
              Required: ability to acquire a working knowledge of robotics, Electronic engineering, problem-solving skills, and simple computer programming skills
              
              Required: strong teamwork and interpersonal skills; ability to work with elementary-aged children in a co-teaching capacity
              
              Preferred: computer science/math/science/engineering background and/or experience with robotics
              
              Preferred: experience working with children.
